body: I’ve been thinking about starting #yoga. Any recommendations for #beginners? #fitness #wellness

comments.body: Start with some YouTube videos! There are a lot of beginner yoga routines out there. I recommend Yoga with Adriene; she has a whole series for beginners.
@90909 Thanks! I’ve heard of her. I’ll check out her beginner series.
Try to focus on your breathing as much as the poses. Yoga is as much about mindfulness as it is about flexibility.
@12321 Good tip! I’ll try to keep that in mind. I’m usually pretty bad at staying focused.
It gets easier with time. Just remember to go slow and don’t be too hard on yourself if your mind wanders.
You might want to invest in a good yoga mat. It makes a big difference in comfort, especially for longer sessions.
@45654 Any specific brand you recommend? I’m not sure what to look for in a mat.
Manduka makes some of the best mats, but they’re a bit pricey. If you want something more budget-friendly, try Gaiam. Both are great for beginners.
Make sure to stretch before and after each session. Even though yoga is all about stretching, it’s good to loosen up beforehand to avoid injury.
@78987 I didn’t realize that! I thought yoga was the stretching. I’ll make sure to warm up.
